arts.ttl: Monza stand by Nesta after Lecce defeat
arts.sum: Monza have reaffirmed its support for head coach Alessandro Nesta following a challenging 2-1 defeat against Lecce, marking the team's eighth loss of the season. The post Monza stand by Nesta after Lecce defeat appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Alessandro Nesta vows to fight on despite Monza’s struggles
arts.sum: Monza coach Alessandro Nesta has expressed his determination to turn around the team’s fortunes following their third consecutive defeat, a disappointing loss to Lecce. Despite the team’s struggles and their position at the bottom of the Serie A table, the club’s management has opted to retain Nesta’s leadership. In a candid post-match press conference, Nesta addressed the team’s performance and his own accountability. “We conceded early, and it was a significant step backward compared to our previous matches. We were inferior,” he stated. arts.ttl: Lecce vs. Monza, a lunchtime six-pointer
arts.sum: In the four previous Serie A matches between Lecce and Monza, there were three 1-1 draws and a 1-0 away win for Lecce; therefore, the Salento haveteam scored exactly one goal in each of the four matches against the Biancorossi in the Italian top-flight. Lecce are unbeaten in the four home matches played between Serie A and Serie B against Monza in the current century: three draws and a single victory, a 3-0 in the Cadetteria on 01/10/2021 (goals scored by Strefezza, Di Mariano and Tail).
